aboutScholarships.title: What is a Scholarship?
aboutScholarships.whatIs: A scholarship is financial aid provided to students to help cover the cost of education. Unlike loans, scholarships do not need to be repaid. They are awarded based on various criteria such as academic merit, financial need, field of study, or community involvement.
aboutScholarships.fullDesc: Covers all tuition fees, living expenses, and sometimes travel costs. This is the most competitive type.
aboutScholarships.partialDesc: Covers part of the tuition fees. Students need to fund the remaining costs themselves.
aboutScholarships.grantDesc: One-time or recurring financial assistance, often based on financial need rather than academic merit.
aboutScholarships.step1: Browse our scholarship database and use filters to narrow your search
aboutScholarships.step2: Check eligibility requirements carefully before applying
aboutScholarships.step3: Note application deadlines and prepare documents early
aboutScholarships.step4: Prepare your application materials (transcripts, recommendation letters, motivation letter)

aboutScholarships.tip5: Apply to multiple scholarships to increase your chances
